intro: Cordia hatschbachii, commonly known as the Schomburgk's cordia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
